metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11356 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The CalDAV feature in httpd in Cyrus IMAP 2.5.x through 2.5.12 and 3.0.x through 3.0.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTTP PUT operation for an event with a long iCalendar property name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11356` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-caldav - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-clients - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-common - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-imapd - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-murder - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-nntpd - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-pop3d - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
cyrus-replication - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
libcyrus-imap-perl - 2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.10-3ubuntu1.1').
